stories.title: Truckers in France are starting to prepare for a freedom Convoy
Neil Young’s Spotify Protest Isn’t Censorship, It’s Exercising His Free Market

stories.text:
How HN can better live up to the aspirational "On-Topic" guidelines: Nuke every thread that reaches ~2e+2 comments, no exceptions.

This is based on the logic that nothing intellectual appeals to all that many people. Intellects vary too much. Search your feelings. You know it to be true.

And hey, there are no ads anyway, so what's the downside?
stories.title: A modest proposal for improving HN

stories.text:
Hi HN, this is a project we've been working on for a while in coordination with a few universities. The aim is to bring a culture of collaboration to educational software by making a developer-friendly platform that can still be used by non-technical teachers. We've adopted Deno which has been a perfect fit so far.

Feel free to check us out on GitHub:

https://github.com/edrys-org/edrys
stories.title: Edrys: The open remote teaching platform (Deno-based)

stories.text:
Conducting a long-term study on effects of VR is challenging if not outright impossible with accuracy.

Yet - multiple historical instances of things that have generated mass adoption (E.g. cigarettes, lead, uranium glassware) were later discovered to have health consequences

Could this be a risk with VR?
stories.title: Ask HN: Long-Term Effects of VR?
Adaptive deep learning-based neighborhood search method for point cloud
